item.description:
Hi Everyone,

The Wildlife Refuge is a beautiful scenic area, some sections recovered and rehabilitated by RI DEM from 1995 and continuing to present(see link). 
http://www.fws.gov/refuges/profiles/index.cfm?id=53543 . 

This winter a snowy owl has taken up residence at the refuge.  Hopefully we get an opportunity to see this large white owl at Sachuest Point during the 1.5 hour walk around.  Deer are, also, very common to see on the trail and seal numbers around the coast should increase.  Bring binoculars, camera, warm jacket, gloves and decent winter shoes.   

After the walk we are invited to a local residence for "order in" lunch, pizza and soft drinks.  You can bring some beer and wine. We will compare notes on our bird watch experience  and relax. 

I'm repeating this due to Projo article this past Sunday.  That should draw a crowd to the "point" and what a way to start bird watching as a hobby.  I must thank Mr. Robert Weaver for sharing such fine photos with me and, hey, we scooped the newspaper.

If anyone has suggestions for later afternoon happenings just put your ideas in comments.

The weather should be much nicer but it is always New England weather just the same.
item.name: Wildlife Refuge @ Sachuest Point , Middletown, RI
